intro: Pastinaca cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf parsley or heartleaf cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of theApiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Pastinaca cordata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
